{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-162-11-B
|Item_parent=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Item_parent_short=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the clinical signs of an upper genital infection in women (salpingitis, endometritis)
|Description=None
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=11}}
- PID:

- +/- fever

- Pelvic pain, metrorrhagia, +/- leucorrhoea

- Gynaecological examination: pain on vaginal touch, endocervical inflammation


- Endometritis: fever +++, increased pelvic pain on VT, discharge from the cervical os

question.question: What are common clinical signs of an upper genital infection in women (salpingitis, endometritis)?
question.option_a: Lower abdominal pain and vaginal discharge
question.option_b: Pelvic pain, metrorrhagia, and leucorrhoea, with pain on vaginal touch and endocervical inflammation
question.option_c: Fever, lower back pain, and testicular swelling
question.option_d: Rectal pain, diarrhea, and anal discharge
